alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough; Pasco; Pinellas (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 9:06PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Florida, including the following counties, Hillsborough, Pasco and Pinellas. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 906 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Port Richey, Holiday, East Lake, Keystone, New Port Richey East, Beacon Square, Palm Harbor, Jasmine Estates, Citrus Park, Greater Northdale, Greater Carrollwood, Trinity, Elfers, Lake Fern, Jay B Starkey Wilderness Park, Odessa and Westchase. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
